intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pannoniciforme, commonly known as the Pannonian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
